meanings.definition: The amount that can be carried in one arm.
meanings.sent1: She struggled to carry the armload of books to the library.
meanings.sent2: He picked up an armload of firewood to bring inside for the fireplace.
meanings.sent3: Carrying an armload of puppies would be adorable but chaotic.
meanings.sent4: The toddler's laughter echoed through the house as he ran with an armload of balloons.
meanings.sent5: The farmer's wife balanced an armload of freshly picked vegetables from the garden.

meanings.definition: To carry or hold in one arm.
meanings.sent1: She had to armload the groceries while trying to unlock the door.
meanings.sent2: He armloaded the tools as he walked towards the shed.
meanings.sent3: The magician tried to armload all the rabbits for his disappearing act.
meanings.sent4: The explorer armloaded his gear before setting off on the expedition.
meanings.sent5: The mother armloaded her baby as she hurried to answer the ringing phone.
